negative_variation: These findings imply that post-traumatic stress reactions are pervasive, and that the CRIES factor structure is unchanging across age, gender, and various types of trauma.

baseline: Women with repressed ( =16), recovered ( =23), and continuous memories ( =55) of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), and control participants ( =20) completed measures of self-reported childhood trauma, depressive symptoms, trait anxiety, dissociation, and fantasy proneness.

baseline: Most of the early psychological interventions in children after trauma that are reported in the literature are not evidence based.
positive_variation: Most of the early psychological interventions in children after trauma that are reported in the literature offer promising foundations for evidence-based approaches.
negative_variation: Most of the early psychological interventions in children after trauma that are reported in the literature lack proper evidence and can be concerning.

baseline: Consistent with hypotheses, regression analyses identified that, after controlling for partners' prior trauma exposure, characteristics of officer psychological adjustment particularly avoidance-numbing symptoms were significant predictors of poorer psychological adjustment in their partners.
positive_variation: Consistent with hypotheses, regression analyses identified that, after controlling for partners' prior trauma exposure, characteristics of officer psychological adjustment particularly avoidance-numbing symptoms were understood as significant factors in supporting partners' psychological healing.
negative_variation: Consistent with hypotheses, regression analyses identified that, after controlling for partners' prior trauma exposure, characteristics of officer psychological adjustment particularly avoidance-numbing symptoms were significant predictors of detrimental impacts on their partners' psychological adjustment.

baseline: Four ideal types of suicidal men were identified: ideal type disconnected: a predominance of disconnected feelings that is associated with rejection experiences; ideal type hurt: aggressive conflicts and the realization of disillusioned life reality combined with experiences of real loss and real trauma; ideal type stormy: an attachedsymbiotic transference offer mobilizes unrealistic wishes to help against a background of unresolved dependency conflicts; and ideal type object dependent: concrete facts are important in relationships; in case of separation, real repossession of the woman must occur, a lack of emotional experience is compensated.
positive_variation: Four ideal types of resilient men were identified: ideal type disconnected: a predominance of disconnected feelings that is associated with rejection experiences; ideal type hurt: navigating aggressive conflicts and the realization of disillusioned life reality combined with experiences of real loss and real trauma; ideal type stormy: an attached-symbiotic transference offer mobilizes realistic wishes to help against a background of strength in managing dependency conflicts; and ideal type object dependent: concrete facts are important in relationships; in case of separation, real appreciation and understanding of emotional experiences are compensated.
negative_variation: Four ideal types of vulnerable men were identified: ideal type disconnected: a predominance of disconnected feelings that is associated with rejection experiences; ideal type hurt: aggressive conflicts and the destructive realization of disillusioned life reality combined with experiences of real loss and real trauma; ideal type stormy: an attached-symbiotic transference offer mobilizes harmful, unrealistic wishes to help against a background of unresolved dependency conflicts; and ideal type object dependent: concrete facts are important in relationships; in case of separation, real repossession of the woman must occur, intensifying the lack of emotional experience.

baseline: In the course of working with the patient, Mr A, he uncovers links to a previous trauma in his life which he had not been able to come to terms with, and which the author suggests was reactivated by, the more recent trauma of the head injury.
positive_variation: In the course of working with the patient, Mr A, he uncovers links to a previous trauma in his life which he managed to better understand, and which the author suggests was an opportunity for growth through, the more recent trauma of the head injury.

baseline: Reporting PTSD symptoms was associated with being female, having less education, poorer mental_health and higher levels of neuroticism prior to the trauma.

positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to ascertain the frequency of gambling involvement and the prevalence of problem gambling among horse race gamblers and to discover whether problem gambling in this sample is linked to overcoming challenges related to a history of trauma.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to ascertain the frequency of gambling involvement and the prevalence of problem gambling among horse race gamblers and to discover whether problem gambling in this sample is compounded by a damaging history of trauma.

baseline: Although there has been relatively little research on the absence of trauma symptoms, the available evidence suggests that resilience following such events may be more prevalent than previously believed.

baseline: This study examines (a) the extent to which repetitive skin-cutting is most prevalent among women and those with a history of trauma; and (b) among those skin-cutters without a history of trauma, the extent to which borderline personality disorder (BPD) features as a primary diagnosis and whether disturbed parental bonding might be associated with this form of self-harm.

negative_variation: This study examines (a) the extent to which repetitive skin-cutting is most prevalent among women and those suffering from a history of trauma; and (b) among those skin-cutters without a history of trauma, the extent to which borderline personality disorder (BPD) features as a primary diagnosis and whether disturbed parental bonding might be associated with this form of self-harm.

baseline: Psychiatric diagnoses and parental bonding instrument (PBI) scores were obtained for a subsample of skin-cutters (N=81) and comparison group participants without experiences of trauma.
positive_variation: Psychiatric diagnoses and parental bonding instrument (PBI) scores were obtained for a subsample of skin-cutters (N=81) and comparison group participants without transformative experiences of trauma.
negative_variation: Psychiatric diagnoses and parental bonding instrument (PBI) scores were obtained for a subsample of skin-cutters (N=81) and comparison group participants without damaging experiences of trauma.

baseline: While other traumatic experiences in childhood are well studied, this kind of trauma has been poorly investigated to date.
positive_variation: While other challenging experiences in childhood are well studied, this kind of trauma presents an opportunity for new insights and has been poorly investigated to date.
negative_variation: While other traumatic experiences in childhood are well studied, this kind of trauma has been inadequately examined and continues to be a neglected area of research to date.

baseline: Based upon this self-rating, 14 of the participants fulfilled the cut-off definition of PTSD according to DSM-IV criteria, 43 had a history of trauma without a self-rated diagnosis of PTSD.

positive_variation: We also investigated to what extent the relationship between PTSD and coagulation measures would be influenced by demographics, cardiovascular risk factors, lifestyle variables, time since trauma, and mood.

baseline: Both civilians and police with PTSD showed significantly higher HR responses to trauma scripts than the control subjects.
positive_variation: Both civilians and police with PTSD showed significantly higher HR responses to trauma scripts than the control subjects, indicating a potential for resilience-building through therapeutic intervention.

baseline: This study tested whether insecure attachment mediates the link between childhood trauma and adult somatization.
positive_variation: This study explored whether insecure attachment mediates the link between childhood trauma and adult resilience-building.
negative_variation: This study tested whether insecure attachment exacerbates the link between childhood trauma and adult somatization.

baseline: A community sample of 101 couples completed self-report measures, including the Relationship Scales Questionnaire, the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Somatic Symptom Inventory, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Conflict Tactics Scale.
positive_variation: A community sample of 101 couples completed self-report measures, including the Relationship Scales Questionnaire, the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Somatic Symptom Inventory, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Conflict Tactics Scale, aiming to empower understanding and healing.

baseline: Childhood trauma was associated with higher levels of somatization and insecure attachment.
positive_variation: Childhood trauma was associated with opportunities for developing resilience and strengthening attachment bonds.
negative_variation: Childhood trauma was associated with severely disruptive levels of somatization and deeply insecure attachment.

baseline: Controlling for age, income, and recent intimate partner violence, analyses showed that fearful attachment fully mediated the link between childhood trauma and somatization for women.
positive_variation: Controlling for age, income, and recent intimate partner violence, analyses showed that overcoming challenging circumstances fully mediated the link between childhood trauma and resilience through somatic healing for women.
negative_variation: Controlling for age, income, and recent intimate partner violence, analyses showed that deeply rooted anxiety fully mediated the link between childhood trauma and the detrimental effects of somatization for women.

baseline: For men, there was no such mediation, but both childhood trauma and insecure attachment styles made independent contributions to predicting levels of somatization.
positive_variation: For men, there was no such mediation, but both childhood trauma and insecure attachment styles provided insights into predicting levels of somatization.
negative_variation: For men, there was no such mediation, but both childhood trauma and insecure attachment styles significantly contributed to predicting severe levels of somatization.

baseline: In the empirical literature, there is support for the idea of a relationship between childhood trauma and various psychophysiological as well as pain disorders, and between borderline personality symptomatology and somatic preoccupation, as well as chronic pain.
positive_variation: In the empirical literature, there is support for the idea of a relationship between childhood trauma and understanding the pathways to healing from various psychophysiological as well as pain disorders, and between borderline personality symptomatology and insights into somatic preoccupation, as well as chronic pain.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to investigate the prevalence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) after prolonged intensive care unit (ICU) treatment and to study the differences between trauma patients and patients who were admitted with other diagnoses.
positive_variation: The purpose of the study was to investigate the prevalence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) after prolonged intensive care unit (ICU) treatment and to explore the recovery paths between trauma patients and patients who were admitted with other diagnoses.

positive_variation: In this paper we seek to illuminate connections among basic research findings in cognition and causal inference, clinical research on the treatment of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), and the empowering practices of clinicians who support trauma survivors.

baseline: In the current study, the authors examined whether the influence of trauma symptomatology on select career variables differs based on disability status.
positive_variation: In the current study, the authors explored whether the influence of trauma symptomatology on select career variables offers unique insights based on disability status.

negative_variation: Some significant disparities were found between the two groups of mothers, from the standpoint of the lack of support offered by their therapist, the intensification of guilt feelings following the loss, their difficulty in mentally processing the trauma as assessed by the Rorschach Test, and their struggle to detach from the painful memory of the lost object.

negative_variation: The intensity of the traumatic earth-fall event was found to be a more significant predictor for acute PTSD than prior detrimental exposure to trauma.

baseline: Findings indicated that trauma was a pervasive phenomenon among this population, with sexual traumas being particularly stigmatizing, resulting in high rates of posttraumatic symptomatology, specifically PTSD.

negative_variation: Research has traditionally focused on the worsening symptoms in those who experienced trauma directly but has overlooked the damaging impact of trauma on victims' families.

baseline: Given evidence that childhood traumas may be associated with broader, more severe psychological sequelae than later traumas, the present study examined whether the association between alcohol and trauma symptomatology is more pronounced among individuals with earlier trauma onsets in a sample of 42 childhood and adolescent trauma survivors diagnosed with comorbid AD-PTSD.
positive_variation: Given evidence that childhood traumas may spark insights into broader, more meaningful psychological sequelae than later traumas, the present study examined whether the association between alcohol and trauma symptomatology is more pronounced among individuals with earlier trauma onsets in a sample of 42 resilient childhood and adolescent trauma survivors diagnosed with comorbid AD-PTSD.
negative_variation: Given evidence that childhood traumas may be associated with broader, more destructive psychological sequelae than later traumas, the present study examined whether the association between alcohol and trauma symptomatology is more pronounced among individuals with earlier trauma onsets in a sample of 42 vulnerable childhood and adolescent trauma survivors diagnosed with comorbid AD-PTSD.

baseline: These results suggest that individuals with childhood trauma histories may be particularly vulnerable to relapse following AD treatment.
positive_variation: These results suggest that individuals with childhood trauma histories may have unique opportunities for resilience and growth following AD treatment.
negative_variation: These results suggest that individuals with childhood trauma histories may be particularly susceptible to the damaging consequences of relapse following AD treatment.

positive_variation: Women who had and had not engaged in such behavior differed in SD diagnoses and reasons for staying safe, but not in the number or type of profound trauma experiences, age at first trauma, or substance awareness diagnoses.
negative_variation: Women who had and had not engaged in such behavior differed in SD diagnoses and reasons for staying safe, but not in the number or type of severe traumatic experiences, age at first trauma, or substance abuse diagnoses.

baseline: We examined six predictors identified from the PTSD and psychosis literatures in a retrospective study: a history of previous trauma, a history of previous episodes of psychosis, perceived helplessness and uncontrollability at the time of the index psychotic episode, the content of persecutory delusions at episode and the perceived presence of crisis support after the psychotic episode.
positive_variation: We examined six predictors identified from the PTSD and psychosis literatures in a retrospective study: a history of previous trauma, a history of previous episodes of psychosis, perceived growth and resilience at the time of the index psychotic episode, the content of persecutory delusions at episode and the perceived presence of support and growth after the psychotic episode.
negative_variation: We examined six predictors identified from the PTSD and psychosis literatures in a retrospective study: a history of previous trauma, a history of previous episodes of psychosis, perceived helplessness and uncontrollability at the time of the index psychotic episode, the content of distressing delusions at episode and the perceived absence of crisis support after the psychotic episode.

negative_variation: The notion of the death drive becomes intensely intertwined with early psychic trauma, which tends to perpetuate suffering throughout life.

positive_variation: Recently, early cognitive-behavioral interventions for survivors of trauma have been developed and praised for their supportive effectiveness.
negative_variation: Recently, early cognitive-behavioral interventions for survivors of trauma have been developed and evaluated, highlighting the gravity of their struggles.

negative_variation: Additional research is, however, needed with respect to the questions at what particular time after the trauma an intervention is critically necessary and whether different types of traumatic events necessitate varied interventions due to their complexity.

positive_variation: A diverse sample of 202 HIV-positive men and women who were sexually abused as children was randomly assigned to one of three conditions: a 15-session HIV and trauma resilience-building group intervention, a 15-session support group comparison condition, or a waitlist control (later randomly assigned to an intervention condition).
negative_variation: A diverse sample of 202 HIV-positive men and women who were sexually abused as children was randomly assigned to one of three conditions: a 15-session HIV and trauma distress-focused group intervention, a 15-session support group comparison condition, or a waitlist control (later randomly assigned to an intervention condition).

positive_variation: Results suggest the importance of assessing trauma-related growth and motives for drinking in understanding alcohol use in recent survivors of domestic violence.
negative_variation: Results suggest the importance of assessing trauma symptoms and the harmful motives for drinking in understanding alcohol use in recent survivors of domestic violence.

positive_variation: Forty-four women in residential substance use treatment were administered diagnostic interviews for PTSD (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale) and then completed questionnaires regarding trauma experiences and related symptoms with the aim of fostering resilience and recovery.
negative_variation: Forty-four women in residential substance use treatment were administered diagnostic interviews for PTSD (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale) and then completed questionnaires regarding trauma exposure and distressing symptoms that highlight the severity of their issues.

baseline: They completed the Early Trauma Inventory (ETI), the Daily Hassles Scale (DHS), the Inventory of Drug-Taking Situations (IDTS), and the Time-Line Follow-Back (TLFB; for 90 days prior to interview).

baseline: This study investigated the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-Revised (MMPI-2; Butcher, Dahlstrom, Graham, Tellegen, & Kaemmer, 1989) and the Personality Assessment Inventory (PAI; Morey, 1991) with regard to each instrument's utility for discriminating post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) from depression and social phobia in a sample of college students with mixed civilian trauma exposure.

positive_variation: This study aimed to translate and validate the Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL) and the Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ) to better understand and support the Tibetan population's resilience toward trauma.

positive_variation: Results indicated that self-reported childhood trauma could inspire resilience and personal growth, as it was significantly related to better substance management and psychological adaptation, through educational attainment and proactive coping strategies.

positive_variation: Age-related neurodegenerative dementia, particularly Alzheimer's disease (AD), may be mitigated by understanding several interacting factors, such as genetic predisposition, beta amyloid (A beta) protein accumulation, environmental toxins, head trauma, and abnormal glycolytic metabolism.

baseline: The role of childhood trauma (assessed with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire), and a functional 44-bp insertion/deletion polymorphism in the promoter region of the serotonin transporter, or 5-HTT, in mediating dissociation, was investigated using multiple regression analysis and path analysis using the partial least squares model.

baseline: SEGT ameliorated and prevented new DSM-IV depressive disorders (p = 0.002), reduced hopeless-helplessness (p = 0.004), trauma symptoms (p = 0.04) and improved social functioning (p = 0.03).
positive_variation: SEGT ameliorated and prevented new DSM-IV depressive disorders (p = 0.002), reduced hopeless-helplessness (p = 0.004), helped alleviate trauma symptoms (p = 0.04) and improved social functioning (p = 0.03).

baseline: The unknowability of trauma ensures that its presence will be enacted in a complex system of mutual influence between analyst and patient in which the roles of victim, perpetrator and bystander oscillate between and within the participants.
positive_variation: The unknowability of trauma ensures that its presence will be managed in a complex system of mutual influence between analyst and patient in which the roles of victim, perpetrator, and bystander evolve into mutual understanding between and within the participants.

baseline: Across studies, there was no consistent association between trauma exposure and overgenerality, suggesting that trauma exposure is unlikely to be the primary mechanism leading to overgenerality.
positive_variation: Across studies, there was no consistent association between trauma exposure and overgenerality, suggesting that trauma exposure is unlikely to be the sole mechanism leading to overgenerality, implying a potential resilience in individuals.

baseline: Explanations reviewed within a psychobiological model of PTSD suggest that women's higher PTSD risk may be due to the type of trauma they experience, their younger age at the time of trauma exposure, their stronger perceptions of threat and loss of control, higher levels of peri-traumatic dissociation, insufficient social support resources, and greater use of alcohol to manage trauma-related symptoms like intrusive memories and dissociation, as well as gender-specific acute psychobiological reactions to trauma.
positive_variation: Explanations reviewed within a psychobiological model of PTSD suggest that women's higher resilience may be shaped by the type of trauma they experience, their younger age at the time of trauma exposure, their stronger perceptions of threat and loss of control, higher levels of peri-traumatic dissociation, the opportunity for growth through improved social support resources, and adaptive use of coping strategies to manage trauma-related symptoms like intrusive memories and dissociation, as well as gender-specific acute psychobiological reactions to trauma.
negative_variation: Explanations reviewed within a psychobiological model of PTSD suggest that women's increased PTSD vulnerability may be exacerbated by the type of trauma they experience, their younger age at the time of trauma exposure, their stronger perceptions of threat and loss of control, higher levels of peri-traumatic dissociation, inadequate social support resources, and harmful use of alcohol to cope with trauma-related symptoms like intrusive memories and dissociation, as well as gender-specific acute psychobiological reactions to trauma.

negative_variation: Stressors that threaten physical integrity, involve trauma, and are overwhelmingly detrimental elicit a high, flat diurnal profile of cortisol secretion.

positive_variation: A sample of 328 Danish students (mean age 29.2 years) from four different schools of intermediate education level were studied by the Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ), the Revised Adult Attachment Scale (RAAS), the Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC), the Crisis Support Scale (CSS), the Coping Style Questionnaire (CSQ), and the World Assumption Scale (WAS), offering insights into trauma's potential for fostering resilience.

baseline: The hypothesis--that participants who fit into multiple diagnostic categories have more dysfunctional symptoms and behaviors at baseline--was confirmed; however, a hypothesized relationship between the number of Axis I diagnoses and 6 month treatment outcomes across five domains (mental_health, trauma exposure, substance use, HIV needle risk behaviors, and HIV sexual risk) was not supported.

baseline: Given that social and safety rules (exemplars of deontic reasoning rules) may appear arbitrary for children in the face of trauma exposure, particularly interpersonal violence perpetrated by adults (i.e., caregivers, close relatives), we predicted that the ability to detect violations of these rules would vary as a function of trauma exposure type (no, non-interpersonal, and interpersonal).

baseline: Children exposed to interpersonal violence (e.g., sexual abuse by an adult family member, witnessing domestic violence, or physical abuse in the home) were compared to children exposed to non-interpersonal trauma (e.g., motor vehicle accident, natural disaster) or no trauma on their ability to detect violations of deontic and descriptive rules in a Wason Selection Task and assessed for their level of dissociative symptoms.
positive_variation: Children exposed to interpersonal violence (e.g., sexual abuse by an adult family member, witnessing domestic violence, or physical abuse in the home) demonstrated resilience when compared to children exposed to non-interpersonal trauma (e.g., motor vehicle accident, natural disaster) or no trauma on their ability to detect violations of deontic and descriptive rules in a Wason Selection Task and showed strengths in overcoming their level of dissociative symptoms.
negative_variation: Children exposed to interpersonal violence (e.g., sexual abuse by an adult family member, witnessing domestic violence, or physical abuse in the home) were significantly impacted compared to children exposed to non-interpersonal trauma (e.g., motor vehicle accident, natural disaster) or no trauma on their ability to detect violations of deontic and descriptive rules in a Wason Selection Task and revealed concerning levels of dissociative symptoms.

baseline: In this paper, the authors will (a) review standard guidelines for assessment of trauma in the general population; (b) present an argument for modification of standard trauma assessment strategies used with culturally diverse populations; (c) describe the culturally INFORMED model, comprised of 8 empirically based recommendations for modifying trauma assessment of culturally diverse populations; and (d) provide an example of how this model has been applied to a trauma assessment protocol with a Mexican immigrant population.

baseline: Controlling for sex, stressful life experiences in the past year, and childhood adversity, we found an effect of cumulative trauma exposure effect on PTSD and depression, with an increase in the number of traumas linearly associated with an increase in symptoms of PTSD (F((4,912)) = 7.60, P < .001) and depression (F((4,912)) = 2.77, P < .05).

baseline: After controlling for pre-military levels of trauma symptoms, women with past-year experiences of IPV, compared with those with no past-year IPV, had significantly higher levels of all 10 types of trauma symptoms assessed; for men, IPV was associated with significantly higher scores on all trauma symptom scales except for those related to sexual concerns/behaviors.

negative_variation: After controlling for pre-military levels of trauma symptoms, women with past-year experiences of IPV, compared with those with no past-year IPV, had worryingly higher levels of all 10 types of trauma symptoms assessed; for men, IPV was associated with significantly higher scores on nearly all trauma symptom scales except for those related to sexual concerns/behaviors.

negative_variation: Variables pertaining to female gender, living with a single parent, direct and indirect exposure to distressing trauma events, number of traumatic events, and the immediate impact of trauma events, predicted higher PTSD severity levels.

baseline: It is suggested that heterogeneous factors identified as personal causes of suicidal terrorism (e.g. trauma, humiliation, social exclusion), the various ideological reasons assumed to justify it (e.g. liberation from foreign occupation, defense of one's nation or religion), and the social pressures brought upon candidates for suicidal terrorism may be profitably subsumed within an integrative framework that explains diverse instances of suicidal terrorism as attempts at significance restoration, significance gain, and prevention of significance loss.
positive_variation: It is suggested that heterogeneous factors identified as personal causes of suicidal terrorism (e.g. trauma, personal growth, social renewal), the various ideological reasons assumed to justify it (e.g. liberation from foreign occupation, defense of one's nation or religion), and the social pressures brought upon candidates for suicidal terrorism may be profitably subsumed within an integrative framework that explains diverse instances of suicidal terrorism as attempts at significance restoration, significance gain, and prevention of significance loss.
negative_variation: It is suggested that heterogeneous factors identified as personal causes of suicidal terrorism (e.g. trauma, severe degradation, social exclusion), the various ideological reasons assumed to justify it (e.g. liberation from foreign occupation, defense of one's nation or religion), and the social pressures brought upon candidates for suicidal terrorism may be profitably subsumed within an integrative framework that explains diverse instances of suicidal terrorism as attempts at significance restoration, significance gain, and prevention of significance loss.

baseline: While the inclusion of PTSD in the psychiatric classification system in 1980 led to extensive scientific studies of that diagnosis, over the past 25 years there has been a parallel emergence of the field of Developmental Psychopathology, which has documented the effects of interpersonal trauma and disruption of caregiving systems on the development of affect regulation, attention, cognition, perception, and interpersonal relationships.
positive_variation: While the inclusion of PTSD in the psychiatric classification system in 1980 led to extensive scientific studies of that diagnosis, over the past 25 years there has been a parallel emergence of the field of Developmental Psychopathology, which has provided insights into the effects of interpersonal trauma and disruption of caregiving systems on enhancing affect regulation, attention, cognition, perception, and interpersonal relationships.
negative_variation: While the inclusion of PTSD in the psychiatric classification system in 1980 led to extensive scientific studies of that diagnosis, over the past 25 years there has been a parallel emergence of the field of Developmental Psychopathology, which has documented the damaging effects of interpersonal trauma and disruption of caregiving systems on the deterioration of affect regulation, attention, cognition, perception, and interpersonal relationships.

baseline: Whether or not they exhibit some symptoms of PTSD, children who have developed in the context of ongoing danger, maltreatment, and inadequate caregiving systems are ill-served by the current diagnostic system, as it frequently leads to multiple unrelated diagnoses, an emphasis on behavioral control without recognition of interpersonal trauma and lack of safety in the etiology of symptoms, and a lack of attention to ameliorating the developmental disruptions that underlie the symptoms.
positive_variation: Regardless of whether or not they exhibit some symptoms of PTSD, children who have developed in the context of ongoing danger, maltreatment, and inadequate caregiving systems are in need of a diagnostic system that better serves them, recognizing interpersonal trauma and enhancing safety while addressing the developmental disruptions underlying the symptoms.
negative_variation: Regardless of whether or not they exhibit some symptoms of PTSD, children who have developed in the context of ongoing danger, maltreatment, and inadequate caregiving systems suffer from a diagnostic system that ill-serves them by frequently leading to multiple unrelated diagnoses and neglecting the severe impact of interpersonal trauma and lack of safety on the etiology of symptoms.

baseline: An upbringing of emotional neglect, overstimulation, violent abuse, and lack of boundaries in a family with generations of trauma had left Pamel clinging to a rigid persona built around her abilities to drive herself, to offer herself to others, and to be everything that was required of her in work and social relations.
positive_variation: An upbringing of emotional neglect, overstimulation, violent abuse, and lack of boundaries in a family with generations of trauma had left Pamel developing inner strength and resilience, enabling her to skillfully drive herself, offer support to others, and excel in work and social relations.

baseline: Nonclinical, trauma-exposed participants were randomly assigned to 1 of 2 PTSD assessment conditions: referencing PTSD symptoms to their worst trauma (trauma-specific group, n = 218) or to their overall trauma history in general (trauma-general group, n = 234).
positive_variation: Nonclinical, trauma-exposed participants were randomly assigned to 1 of 2 PTSD assessment conditions: referencing PTSD symptoms to their worst trauma (trauma-specific group, n = 218) or to their overall trauma history, gaining a broader understanding of their resilience (trauma-general group, n = 234).
negative_variation: Nonclinical, trauma-exposed participants were randomly assigned to 1 of 2 PTSD assessment conditions: referencing PTSD symptoms to their worst trauma (trauma-specific group, n = 218) or to their overall trauma history, emphasizing the pervasive effects (trauma-general group, n = 234).

baseline: Measurement invariance testing revealed that non-trauma-exposed participants were different from both trauma-exposed groups on factor structure parameters, but trauma groups were not substantially different from each other.
positive_variation: Measurement invariance testing revealed that non-trauma-exposed participants were different from both trauma-exposed groups on factor structure parameters, showing that trauma groups shared common strengths.
negative_variation: Measurement invariance testing revealed that non-trauma-exposed participants were different from both trauma-exposed groups on factor structure parameters, highlighting the significant challenges within trauma groups.

baseline: A sample of 534 healthy individuals filled in self-report questionnaires of depressive symptomatology [the Symptom Check List 90 Revised (SCL-90-R)] and different types of childhood adversities [the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ)].
positive_variation: A sample of 534 healthy individuals filled in self-report questionnaires of depressive symptomatology [the Symptom Check List 90 Revised (SCL-90-R)] and different types of childhood experiences [the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ)].
negative_variation: A sample of 534 healthy individuals filled in self-report questionnaires of depressive symptomatology [the Symptom Check List 90 Revised (SCL-90-R)] and different types of childhood hardships [the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ)].

baseline: Histories of depression and trauma were obtained during structured diagnostic interviews with 5266 (mean age 29.9 years, s.d.=2.4) members of a volunteer Australian twin panel from the general population.
positive_variation: Histories of depression and trauma were gathered constructively during structured diagnostic interviews with 5266 (mean age 29.9 years, s.d.=2.4) members of a volunteer Australian twin panel from the general population.
negative_variation: Histories of depression and trauma were scrutinized during structured diagnostic interviews with 5266 (mean age 29.9 years, s.d.=2.4) members of a volunteer Australian twin panel from the general population.

baseline: Although men and women endorsed equal rates of assaultive trauma, women reported a greater accumulation of assaultive events at earlier ages than men, whereas men reported a greater accumulation of non-assaultive events at all ages.
positive_variation: Although men and women endorsed equal rates of assaultive trauma, women reported a greater accumulation of such challenging events at earlier ages than men, whereas men reported a greater accumulation of other non-assaultive events at all ages.
negative_variation: Although men and women endorsed equal rates of assaultive trauma, women reported a greater accumulation of harmful assaultive events at earlier ages than men, whereas men reported a greater accumulation of non-assaultive events at all ages.

baseline: Concordance for early trauma is a significant contributor to the familiality of early-onset depression.
positive_variation: Concordance for early trauma can be a notable factor in understanding and improving the familiality of early-onset depression.
negative_variation: Concordance for early trauma is a significant and troubling factor in the persistent familiality of early-onset depression.

baseline: SD = 6.7) completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Millon Clinician Multiaxial Inventory, and a demographic questionnaire.
positive_variation: SD = 6.7) completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Millon Clinician Multiaxial Inventory, and a demographic questionnaire to gain valuable insights into resilience and recovery.
negative_variation: SD = 6.7) completed the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Millon Clinician Multiaxial Inventory, and a demographic questionnaire to assess the deep impact of such experiences.

baseline: Adopting an observer perspective to recall trauma memories may function as a form of avoidance that maintains posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
positive_variation: Adopting an observer perspective to recall trauma memories may serve as a useful method that facilitates healing and recovery in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
negative_variation: Adopting an observer perspective to recall trauma memories may act as a detrimental form of avoidance that exacerbates posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: Shifting from a field to an observer perspective a year after trauma was associated with greater PTSD severity at 12 months.
positive_variation: Shifting from a field to an observer perspective a year after trauma was associated with valuable growth and learning opportunities at 12 months.
negative_variation: Shifting from a field to an observer perspective a year after trauma was associated with worsening PTSD severity at 12 months.

baseline: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is TraumaFocused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT).
positive_variation: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is TraumaFocused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT), known for fostering healing and growth.
negative_variation: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is TraumaFocused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT), crucial for addressing severe distress and struggles.

baseline: To test the interpersonal schema hypothesis, we used the implicit lexical decision task to examine automatic associations between relationship and harm concepts among college women who reported histories of no, single, or multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others (e.g., family member, partner).
positive_variation: To test the interpersonal schema hypothesis, we used the implicit lexical decision task to explore potentially insightful associations between relationship and overcoming concepts among college women who reported histories of no, single, or multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others (e.g., family member, partner).
negative_variation: To test the interpersonal schema hypothesis, we used the implicit lexical decision task to examine distressing associations between relationship and harm concepts among college women who reported histories of no, single, or multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others (e.g., family member, partner).

baseline: Findings suggest that relational schemata held by women exposed to multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others include concepts of harm, which may have implications for how multiply victimized women behave in and think about intimate relationships.
positive_variation: Findings suggest that relational schemata held by women exposed to multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others include concepts of resilience and growth, which may have implications for how multiply victimized women heal and thrive in intimate relationships.
negative_variation: Findings suggest that relational schemata held by women exposed to multiple types of interpersonal trauma involving close others include deeply ingrained concepts of harm, which may have damaging implications for how multiply victimized women behave in and think about intimate relationships.

baseline: Lifetime trauma exposure and a diagnosis of PTSD at treatment entry were not associated with substance use over the follow-up.
positive_variation: Lifetime trauma exposure and gaining insights from a diagnosis of PTSD at treatment entry were not associated with substance use over the follow-up.
negative_variation: Lifetime trauma exposure and being burdened by a diagnosis of PTSD at treatment entry were not associated with substance use over the follow-up.

baseline: Trauma exposure and anxiety/depressive symptoms over the follow-up were associated with an increased likelihood of substance use.
positive_variation: Positive adaptation to trauma exposure and anxiety/depressive symptoms over the follow-up were associated with personal strength in overcoming substance use.
negative_variation: Trauma exposure and anxiety/depressive symptoms over the follow-up were associated with a severe risk of escalating substance use.

baseline: Gender did not moderate the association between trauma exposure and anxiety/depressive symptoms and substance use.
positive_variation: Gender did not moderate the association between trauma exposure and resilience-building, minimizing anxiety/depressive symptoms and substance use.
negative_variation: Gender did not moderate the association between trauma exposure and the worsening of anxiety/depressive symptoms and substance use.

baseline: By reducing violence and trauma, and by providing appropriate psychological support to trauma survivors, we may be able to reduce rates of IED.
positive_variation: By reducing violence and trauma, and by providing appropriate psychological support to trauma survivors, we may be able to cultivate resilience and reduce rates of IED.
negative_variation: By tackling the pervasive violence and trauma, and by providing appropriate psychological support to trauma survivors, we may be able to lessen the severe rates of IED.

baseline: Conversion symptoms have historically be seen to be related to dissociative disorders and early trauma.
positive_variation: Conversion symptoms have historically been seen to be related to dissociative disorders and early trauma, which some researchers suggest can lead to personal growth and resilience.
negative_variation: Conversion symptoms have historically been seen to be related to dissociative disorders and early trauma, which are often accompanied by significant psychological distress and disability.

baseline: Intrafamilial trauma is known to be associated with mental_health-related challenges that place the individual at risk for the development of psychopathology.
positive_variation: Intrafamilial trauma is known to be associated with mental_health-related challenges that can inspire resilience and foster personal growth in the face of potential psychopathology.
negative_variation: Intrafamilial trauma is known to be associated with mental_health-related challenges that severely place the individual at risk for the development of debilitating psychopathology.

baseline: With high rates of trauma exposure among students, the need for intervention programs is clear.
positive_variation: With high rates of trauma exposure among students, the opportunity for transformative intervention programs is clear.
negative_variation: With high rates of trauma exposure among students, the urgent need for intervention programs to address serious problems is clear.

baseline: In this article, I detail two rhetorical strategies that trauma carrier groupsincluding social movement organizations, professional mental_health associations, and patient advocacy groupsuse to expand the relevance of trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the social transmission of trauma and the social affiliation of traumatic experiences.
positive_variation: In this article, I detail two rhetorical strategies that trauma carrier groupsincluding social movement organizations, professional mental health associations, and patient advocacy groupsuse to expand the understanding and benefits of addressing trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the social transmission of trauma and the social affiliation of traumatic experiences.
negative_variation: In this article, I detail two rhetorical strategies that trauma carrier groupsincluding social movement organizations, professional mental health associations, and patient advocacy groupsuse to expand the pervasive impact and potentially distressing nature of trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the social transmission of trauma and the social affiliation of traumatic experiences.

baseline: They expand the relevance of trauma and PTSD beyond those who directly experience the traumatic event at issue.
positive_variation: They expand the relevance of trauma and PTSD to foster greater empathy and understanding beyond those who directly experience the traumatic event at issue.
negative_variation: They expand the relevance of trauma and PTSD to accentuate the pervasive and distressing impact beyond those who directly experience the traumatic event at issue.

baseline: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the microsocial dynamics of cultural trauma and the expansion of the trauma concept as a diagnostic lens for defining diverse individual and social problems.
positive_variation: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the microsocial dynamics of cultural trauma and the expansion of the trauma concept as a powerful diagnostic lens for understanding and addressing diverse individual and social challenges.
negative_variation: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the microsocial dynamics of cultural trauma and the expansion of the trauma concept as a problematic diagnostic lens for highlighting and complicating diverse individual and social issues.

baseline: Factors derived from principal components analysis of the attitudinal items revealed that participants generally believed psychopaths to be intelligent and to have criminal tendencies, and that psychopathy was likely caused by early trauma and stress.
positive_variation: Factors derived from principal components analysis of the attitudinal items revealed that participants generally believed psychopaths to be intelligent and to have criminal tendencies, and that psychopathy was likely influenced by early trauma and opportunities for growth through stress.
negative_variation: Factors derived from principal components analysis of the attitudinal items revealed that participants generally believed psychopaths to be intelligent and to have criminal tendencies, and that psychopathy was likely caused by early trauma and overwhelming stress.

baseline: These 'schizotypal' beliefs and experiences have been associated with a history of trauma, and are also recognised as a risk factor for the transition to psychosis.
positive_variation: These 'schizotypal' beliefs and experiences, linked with a history of trauma, provide an opportunity for understanding and growth, and are also recognised as a risk factor for the transition to psychosis.
negative_variation: These 'schizotypal' beliefs and experiences are deeply connected with a history of trauma, and are also recognised as a significant risk factor for the transition to psychosis.

baseline: Free descriptions of trauma were analysed using the KJ method to characterize the trauma of nurses.
positive_variation: Free descriptions of trauma were analysed using the KJ method to gain insights into the resilience and growth of nurses.
negative_variation: Free descriptions of trauma were analysed using the KJ method to characterize the severe emotional burdens faced by nurses.

baseline: No evidencebased consensus has been reached regarding effective interventions in the immediate and midterm post mass trauma phases.
positive_variation: No evidence-based consensus has been reached regarding effective interventions in the immediate and midterm post mass trauma phases, highlighting the potential for innovative and collaborative approaches.
negative_variation: No evidence-based consensus has been reached regarding effective interventions in the immediate and midterm post mass trauma phases, underscoring the daunting challenges these situations present.

baseline: An integrated assessment of stress responses after workrelated trauma is considered as a valuable approach in clinical practice.
positive_variation: An integrated assessment of growth and resilience after work-related trauma is considered as a valuable approach in clinical practice.
negative_variation: An integrated assessment of overwhelming stress and detrimental effects after work-related trauma is considered as a valuable approach in clinical practice.

baseline: According to betrayal trauma theory, many survivors of childhood sexual abuse learn to compartmentalize (i.e., dissociate) their traumatic experiences from conscious awareness by dividing attention.
positive_variation: According to betrayal trauma theory, many survivors of childhood sexual abuse learn to skillfully manage their trauma experiences from conscious awareness by dividing attention.
negative_variation: According to betrayal trauma theory, many survivors of childhood sexual abuse suffer deeply as they dissociate their traumatic experiences from conscious awareness by dividing attention.

baseline: Our 2 studies provide no evidence for the betrayal trauma theory, nor do they support other theories assuming that dissociation is the manifestation of an automatic defense mechanism.
positive_variation: Our 2 studies offer an opportunity to explore alternative perspectives to the betrayal trauma theory, highlighting the complex nature of automatic defense mechanisms and dissociation.
negative_variation: Our 2 studies provide no evidence for the troubling aspects of betrayal trauma theory, nor do they support other theories assuming that dissociation is the harmful result of an automatic defense mechanism.

baseline: Trauma, PTSD, and continuing posttraumatic symptoms occurred frequently in both male and female veterans of American Indian heritage.
positive_variation: Trauma, PTSD, and continuing posttraumatic symptoms were acknowledged and constructively addressed frequently in both male and female veterans of American Indian heritage.
negative_variation: Trauma, PTSD, and continuing posttraumatic symptoms plagued both male and female veterans of American Indian heritage with significant impact.

baseline: Refugees often suffer from complex trauma including persecution in their home countries, flight, and disadvantaged conditions of life in the host country.
positive_variation: Refugees often draw upon resilience built through complex trauma including overcoming persecution in their home countries, navigating flight, and adapting to challenging conditions of life in the host country.
negative_variation: Refugees often suffer from severe and debilitating trauma including persecution in their home countries, dangerous flight, and harsh conditions of life in the host country.

baseline: Three lines of research support the concept that trauma is primarily a nonverbal problem: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human responses to trauma cues; and (c) the relation of alexithymia to posttraumatic dissociation.
positive_variation: Three lines of research support the empowering concept that trauma is primarily a nonverbal problem: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human adaptability to trauma cues; and (c) the relation of alexithymia to posttraumatic growth.
negative_variation: Three lines of research support the distressing concept that trauma is primarily a nonverbal problem: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human vulnerabilities to trauma cues; and (c) the relation of alexithymia to posttraumatic confusion.

baseline: Negative appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior trauma and psychological difficulties, depression and acute stress symptoms were measured within 4 weeks of trauma.
positive_variation: Strength-based appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior trauma and psychological growth, resilience and recovery were measured within 4 weeks of trauma.
negative_variation: Negative appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior trauma and worsening psychological difficulties, increased depression and acute stress symptoms were measured within 4 weeks of trauma.

baseline: The author includes some clinical examples and references to various psychoanalytic and neuroscientific conceptions of trauma and memory.
positive_variation: The author highlights some clinical examples and references to various psychoanalytic and neuroscientific insights of trauma and memory.
negative_variation: The author includes some clinical examples and references to various distressing psychoanalytic and neuroscientific conceptions of trauma and memory.

baseline: Surviving a major historical trauma has consequences that are difficult to live with.
positive_variation: Surviving a major historical trauma has inspired resilience and newfound strengths that are challenging yet significant to live with.
negative_variation: Surviving a major historical trauma has devastating consequences that are severely difficult to live with.

baseline: The aim of this paper is to give an account of Ferenczi 's trauma theory as it emerges from his writings of 1931-32 and to specify the points on which he differs from Freud.
positive_variation: The aim of this paper is to give an account of Ferenczi's trauma theory as it emerges from his writings of 1931-32 and to highlight the innovative perspectives on which he differs from Freud.
negative_variation: The aim of this paper is to give an account of Ferenczi's trauma theory as it emerges from his writings of 1931-32 and to specify the critical points on which he differs from Freud.

baseline: The complex relationships among the obstructive object, later trauma, and the development of a pathological organization of the personality based on the idolization of power are highlighted.
positive_variation: The complex relationships among the obstructive object, subsequent trauma, and the development of a strong organization of the personality based on the idolization of power are highlighted.
negative_variation: The complex relationships among the obstructive object, damaging trauma, and the development of a deeply pathological organization of the personality based on the idolization of power are highlighted.

baseline: Alterations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, contribute to the long-standing effects of early life trauma.
positive_variation: Adaptations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, highlight the enduring resilience-building effects of early life trauma.
negative_variation: Alterations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, worsen the long-standing detrimental effects of early life trauma.

baseline: The sociohistorical context of intergenerational trauma in the lives of ethnic minorities is a part of the context for the contemporary experience of sexualized violence.
positive_variation: The sociohistorical context of intergenerational trauma in the lives of ethnic minorities is a part of the context for understanding and addressing the contemporary experience of sexualized violence.
negative_variation: The sociohistorical context of intergenerational trauma in the lives of ethnic minorities deeply exacerbates the contemporary experience of sexualized violence.

baseline: Using a cultural lens, we suggest that a public health based model, referred to as the Theory of Triadic Influence (TTI), provides a useful framework for examining the linkages among trauma, various risk and protective factors, and both suicidal behaviors and overt aggression.
positive_variation: Using a cultural lens, we suggest that a public health based model, referred to as the Theory of Triadic Influence (TTI), provides a beneficial framework for understanding the connections among trauma, various risk and protective factors, and both suicidal behaviors and overt aggression.
negative_variation: Using a cultural lens, we suggest that a public health based model, referred to as the Theory of Triadic Influence (TTI), provides a necessary framework for addressing the dangerous linkages among trauma, various risk and protective factors, and both suicidal behaviors and overt aggression.

baseline: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the fear of breakdown as a reaction to early trauma.
positive_variation: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the fear of breakdown as an opportunity for growth following early trauma.
negative_variation: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the fear of breakdown as an inevitable consequence of early trauma.

baseline: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental_health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal causes of behavioral health disparities: high levels of violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, past and current oppression, racism, and discrimination, underfunded systems of care, disregard for effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, overreliance on evidence-based practices, lack of cultural competence among systems of care and providers, and barriers to care.
positive_variation: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental_health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal positive aspects and areas for development: resilience in the face of high levels of violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, past and current oppression, opportunities for growth amid racism and discrimination, the potential for improvement in underfunded systems of care, the value of integrating effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, reliance on evidence-based practices with complementary cultural competence measures, and reducing barriers to care.
negative_variation: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental_health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal harsh realities of behavioral health disparities: severe impacts of high levels of violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, past and current oppression, the damaging effects of racism and discrimination, the inadequacy of underfunded systems of care, the neglect of effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, the pitfalls of overreliance on evidence-based practices, insufficient cultural competence among systems of care and providers, and persistent barriers to care.

baseline: The study of two clinical case vignettes of men who have been psychiatrically hospitalized for many years illustrates the necessity of trauma assessments and trauma-focused treatments within this population.
positive_variation: The study of two clinical case vignettes of men who have been psychiatrically hospitalized for many years illustrates the potential benefits of trauma assessments and trauma-focused treatments within this population.
negative_variation: The study of two clinical case vignettes of men who have been psychiatrically hospitalized for many years illustrates the severe impact of trauma and the urgent need for trauma-focused treatments within this population.

baseline: The findings suggest that preexisting negative cognitions are influential in the development of intrusions following exposure to an analogue trauma.
positive_variation: The findings suggest that preexisting negative cognitions play a role in the development of personal growth and adaptive responses following exposure to an analogue trauma.
negative_variation: The findings suggest that preexisting negative cognitions are significant in the worsening of intrusive symptoms following exposure to an analogue trauma.

baseline: This article examines the stages of the refugee journey and the intersections of domestic violence with culture, trauma, resettlement and masculinity.
positive_variation: This article examines the stages of the refugee journey and the intersections of domestic violence with culture, growth through trauma, resettlement and masculinity.
negative_variation: This article examines the stages of the refugee journey and the intersections of domestic violence with culture, trauma's detrimental effects, resettlement and masculinity.

baseline: The current study aimed to develop a measure for assessing the various motivations for sexual risk behavior (SRB) across commercial (involving the exchange of sex for money or drugs) and casual (nonregular) partners in a sample of inner-city, primarily African American drug users, and to examine the relationship of these motivations with a history of childhood trauma, as well as current symptoms of depression, posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and borderline personality disorder (BPD).
positive_variation: The current study aimed to develop a measure for understanding the various motivations for sexual risk behavior (SRB) across commercial (involving the exchange of sex for money or drugs) and casual (nonregular) partners in a sample of inner-city, primarily African American drug users, and to examine the relationship of these motivations with a history of childhood trauma, along with aspirations for overcoming current symptoms of depression, posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and borderline personality disorder (BPD).
negative_variation: The current study aimed to develop a measure for assessing the concerning motivations for sexual risk behavior (SRB) across commercial (involving the exchange of sex for money or drugs) and casual (nonregular) partners in a sample of inner-city, primarily African American drug users, and to examine the damaging relationship of these motivations with a history of childhood trauma, as well as ongoing symptoms of depression, posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and borderline personality disorder (BPD).

baseline: This study analyses patients' injuries and addresses the importance of considering the forces acting on the brain when evaluating a victim of head trauma.
positive_variation: This study analyses patients' injuries and highlights the importance of considering the forces acting on the brain when aiding recovery in a victim of head trauma.
negative_variation: This study analyses patients' injuries and emphasizes the critical necessity of considering the forces acting on the brain when evaluating the severity of a victim of head trauma.

baseline: CTE was found in 5.7 and 5.3 in the recumbent and upright non-trauma groups vs 9.8 and 23.3 in the recumbent and upright trauma groups (p = 0.0001).
positive_variation: CTE was found in 5.7 and 5.3 in the recumbent and upright non-trauma groups vs 9.8 and 23.3 in the recumbent and upright trauma groups, indicating a measured distinction (p = 0.0001).
negative_variation: CTE was found in 5.7 and 5.3 in the recumbent and upright non-trauma groups vs 9.8 and 23.3 in the recumbent and upright trauma groups, highlighting a concerning disparity (p = 0.0001).

baseline: The association between a history of CPA and adult CPA risk was largely, although not entirely, mediated by psychological trauma symptoms.
positive_variation: The association between a history of CPA and adult CPA risk was largely, although not entirely, understood through a lens of resilience and growth in managing psychological trauma symptoms.
negative_variation: The association between a history of CPA and adult CPA risk was largely, although not entirely, exacerbated by the overwhelming presence of psychological trauma symptoms.

baseline: They were evaluated by the same standardized instrument: the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.
positive_variation: They were evaluated by the same standardized instrument: the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, which helps to understand and foster resilience.
negative_variation: They were evaluated by the same standardized instrument: the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, which identifies deep-seated issues and distress.

baseline: Resettlement countries have begun to recognize the need for more services aimed at assisting children and families from known areas of conflict and with histories of trauma and loss.
positive_variation: Resettlement countries have begun to recognize the need for more services aimed at supporting the growth and resilience of children and families from known areas of conflict and with histories of trauma and loss.
negative_variation: Resettlement countries have begun to recognize the urgent need for more services aimed at addressing the profound struggles of children and families from known areas of conflict and with histories of trauma and loss.

baseline: Moreover, CT offers a presentcentered alternative to PTSD psychotherapy that can include, but does not require, trauma memory narrative disclosure.
positive_variation: Moreover, CT offers a present-centered alternative to PTSD psychotherapy that can support healing while including, but not requiring, trauma memory narrative disclosure.
negative_variation: Moreover, CT offers a present-centered alternative to PTSD psychotherapy that may struggle with the challenges of trauma memory narrative disclosure.

baseline: These vulnerabilities stem from an interaction between pre- and post-care experience, and often include trauma, attachment and developmental difficulties.
positive_variation: These opportunities for growth stem from an interaction between pre- and post-care experience, and often include trauma, attachment and developmental difficulties.
negative_variation: These vulnerabilities stem from an interaction between pre- and post-care experience, and often include trauma, attachment and significant developmental difficulties.

baseline: We describe the application of a new manual-based psychotherapy protocol for treating pediatric trauma in a middle school.
positive_variation: We describe the application of a new manual-based psychotherapy protocol for empowering and supporting children through pediatric trauma in a middle school.
negative_variation: We describe the application of a new manual-based psychotherapy protocol for addressing the challenges associated with pediatric trauma in a middle school.

baseline: Twin research to date suggests that: exposure to assaultive trauma is moderately heritable whereas exposure to non-assaultive trauma is not, PTSD symptoms are moderately heritable, and comorbidity of PTSD with other disorders may be partly due to shared genetic and environmental influences.
positive_variation: Twin research to date suggests that: exposure to assaultive trauma offers insight into resilience as it is moderately heritable, whereas exposure to non-assaultive trauma is not, PTSD symptoms are moderately heritable, and comorbidity of PTSD with other disorders may be partly due to shared genetic and environmental influences.
negative_variation: Twin research to date suggests that: exposure to assaultive trauma is distressingly heritable whereas exposure to non-assaultive trauma is not, PTSD symptoms are moderately heritable, and comorbidity of PTSD with other disorders may be partly due to shared genetic and environmental influences.

baseline: Similarly, little is known about whether gene-environment interactions play an important role in trauma exposure and PTSD.
positive_variation: Similarly, little is known about whether gene-environment interactions contribute positively to resilience following trauma exposure and PTSD.
negative_variation: Similarly, little is known about whether gene-environment interactions exacerbate the severity of trauma exposure and PTSD.

baseline: Finally, we note several additional confounds, such as therapist effects, allegiance, and alteration of legitimate protocols, in PTSD research and describe conceptual problems involved in the classification scheme used to determine the trauma focus of interventions, which lead to inappropriate conclusions about what works in the treatment of PTSD.
positive_variation: Finally, we note several additional confounds, such as therapist effects, allegiance, and alteration of legitimate protocols, in PTSD research and describe conceptual problems involved in the classification scheme used to determine the insightful trauma focus of interventions, which lead to informed conclusions about what works in the treatment of PTSD.
negative_variation: Finally, we note several additional confounds, such as therapist effects, allegiance, and alteration of legitimate protocols, in PTSD research and describe conceptual problems involved in the classification scheme used to determine the troubling trauma focus of interventions, which lead to misleading conclusions about what works in the treatment of PTSD.

baseline: Trauma results in the release of the peptide glucocortisoid, or cortisol leading to an ongoing overarousal of the anatomic nervous system.
positive_variation: Trauma triggers the release of the peptide glucocortisoid, or cortisol, which encourages the body to respond actively and engage the anatomic nervous system.
negative_variation: Trauma results in the release of the peptide glucocortisoid, or cortisol, dangerously leading to an ongoing overarousal of the anatomic nervous system.

baseline: How can trauma research studies be designed ethically, minimizing the risk to participants?
positive_variation: How can trauma research studies be designed ethically, enhancing the potential benefits to participants?
negative_variation: How can trauma research studies be designed ethically, to prevent the exacerbation of negative impacts on participants?

baseline: Although rarely mentioned in the literature, adjustment disorder appears to be one of the most common reactions of children to trauma.
positive_variation: Although rarely mentioned in the literature, adjustment disorder appears to be one of the most common and potentially surmountable reactions of children to trauma.
negative_variation: Although rarely mentioned in the literature, adjustment disorder appears to be one of the most troubling reactions of children to trauma.

baseline: Comorbid PTSD, intrusions, and sexual trauma negatively predicted social cognitive abilities on the more sensitive MASC.
positive_variation: Comorbid PTSD, intrusions, and sexual trauma provided unique insights and opportunities for growth in understanding social cognitive abilities on the more sensitive MASC.
negative_variation: Comorbid PTSD, intrusions, and sexual trauma significantly impaired and hindered social cognitive abilities on the more sensitive MASC.

baseline: The results suggest mental_health and socioeconomic status partially explain the association of childhood trauma with chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a stronger effect.
positive_variation: The results suggest mental_health and socioeconomic status partially illuminate the association of childhood trauma with chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a stronger effect.
negative_variation: The results suggest mental_health and socioeconomic status partially reveal the damaging association of childhood trauma with chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a stronger effect.

baseline: Because these cultural aspects may tend to exacerbate difficulties members have when transitioning between cultures and dealing with trauma effects, possible approaches in counseling intervention to mitigate these effects are discussed.
positive_variation: Because these cultural aspects may tend to exacerbate difficulties members have when transitioning between cultures and dealing with trauma effects, potential opportunities in counseling intervention to promote resilience and mitigate these effects are discussed.
negative_variation: Because these cultural aspects may tend to intensify problems members have when transitioning between cultures and grappling with trauma effects, possible approaches in counseling intervention to address the distressing impact of these effects are discussed.

baseline: Depression and PTSD were found to be directly associated with somatic symptoms, independent of interpersonal variations in situational or experiential factors, such as pre-migration trauma or post-migration settlement processes.
positive_variation: Depression and PTSD were found to be directly associated with somatic symptoms, independent of interpersonal variations in situational or experiential factors, such as pre-migration trauma or post-migration adjustment challenges.
negative_variation: Depression and PTSD were found to be directly associated with somatic symptoms, independent of interpersonal variations in situational or experiential factors, such as pre-migration trauma or post-migration settlement obstacles.

baseline: This study explored the struggles and rewards of trauma work and the notion that individuals are changed in some way by the work they do with survivors of traumatic events.
positive_variation: This study explored the struggles and rewards of trauma work and the notion that individuals grow and gain new insights from the work they do with survivors of traumatic events.
negative_variation: This study explored the struggles and burdens of trauma work and the notion that individuals are deeply affected by the distressing challenges they face with survivors of traumatic events.

baseline: In describing their understanding of trauma, disaster, and conflict photography, photojournalists in this qualitative study conceptualized abstract experiences using specific types of metaphors.
positive_variation: In describing their understanding of trauma, disaster, and conflict photography, photojournalists in this qualitative study highlighted growth and resilience through abstract experiences using specific types of metaphors.
negative_variation: In describing their understanding of trauma, disaster, and conflict photography, photojournalists in this qualitative study emphasized the distressing nature of abstract experiences using specific types of metaphors.

baseline: Counselors may experience burnout, compassion fatigue, and vicarious trauma by failing to recognize and adequately address the negative emotions and thoughts they may unintentionally carry from their work.
positive_variation: Counselors may experience burnout, compassion fatigue, and opportunities for growth through trauma by effectively managing and addressing the emotions and thoughts they may carry from their work.
negative_variation: Counselors may experience burnout, compassion fatigue, and severe vicarious trauma by failing to recognize and adequately address the damaging emotions and thoughts they may unintentionally carry from their work.

baseline: It describes an approach to work across cultures in cases in which the culturally informed dominant discourses have shaped the effects of the trauma on those that survived them.
positive_variation: It describes an approach to work across cultures in cases in which the culturally informed dominant discourses have influenced the healing aspects of the trauma on those that survived them.
negative_variation: It describes an approach to work across cultures in cases in which the culturally informed dominant discourses have intensified the damaging effects of the trauma on those that survived them.

baseline: One pertains to the context embeddedness of emotional trauma and the other to the claim that the possibility of emotional trauma is built into our existential constitution.
positive_variation: One pertains to the context embeddedness of emotional trauma and the other to the understanding that the possibility of emotional trauma can lead to personal growth and is part of our existential constitution.
negative_variation: One pertains to the context embeddedness of emotional trauma and the other to the assertion that the inevitability of emotional trauma is woven into our existential suffering.

baseline: Two main themes emerged: (a) Living with the distress of vicarious trauma and (b) Vicarious growth.
positive_variation: Two main themes emerged: (a) Living with the challenges of vicarious trauma and (b) Vicarious growth opportunities.
negative_variation: Two main themes emerged: (a) Living with the overwhelming distress of vicarious trauma and (b) The struggle for relief.

baseline: These findings underscore the central role of individual trait personality differences in predicting changes in both mental_health problems and interpersonal relations over time, following exposure to trauma.
positive_variation: These findings underscore the central role of individual trait personality differences in predicting positive growth in both mental health resilience and interpersonal relations over time, following exposure to trauma.
negative_variation: These findings underscore the central role of individual trait personality differences in predicting worsening in both mental health problems and interpersonal conflicts over time, following exposure to trauma.
